meanings.definition: A feeling of dislike or aversion.
meanings.sent1: She wrinkled her nose in distaste at the smell of the garbage.
meanings.sent2: His distaste for broccoli was well-known among his friends.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed distaste for the new brand of cat food by refusing to eat it.
meanings.sent4: The distaste in the air was palpable as the two rivals faced off.
meanings.sent5: The distaste in her expression made it clear she did not approve.

meanings.definition: To have a strong feeling of dislike or aversion towards something.
meanings.sent1: He distasted the idea of going to the dentist.
meanings.sent2: She distastes horror movies because they give her nightmares.
meanings.sent3: The toddler distasted the vegetables on his plate by throwing them on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The detective distasted the suspect's alibi, finding it full of holes.
meanings.sent5: The teacher distasted cheating and always caught students trying to do so.
